title: CSS Transitions
desc: Transitions allows to smoothly change an element's properties over a specified duration when a state change occurs like hovering or clicking.

values.title: Property
values.desc: The CSS property to animate like width, opacity).

values.title: Timing Function
values.desc: Defines the speed curves like ease, linear, ease-in, etc.

values.title: Delay
values.desc: Optional; delays the start of the transition.

explain: when the user hovers over the .button, the background color transitions from blue to green over 0.5 seconds.

title: CSS Keyframes
desc: Keyframes allows to create more complex animations by defining multiple stages of change. Each keyframe represents a different point in time where specific styles should be applied.
desc1: Then we can apply these keyframes to an element using the <code>animation<cod/e> property.
explain: In this example, the .box element slides 100 pixels to the right over 2 seconds and repeats infinitely.
